page.title: 01HOUSING
page.content: Most of the houses in the erea are detached allthough there are a few that are seme detached.The average house was built in Georgian times. Farm houses are mainly large and built in the late 17th century.In the erea there are only a few mobile homes that are in bad condition.There is only one thatched house as thatch is hard to get.Most houses are in good condition and of a fair sise.It is interesting that although most houses are old hardly any were built before 1600.There are holiday homes on Burtle road as is the church at the crossroads that leed onto Burtle road. Mr Richards (the ouner of the post office) owns the holiday homes.
